lines.text: The trumpets sound. Enter KING HENRY IV, PRINCE  HENRY, LORD JOHN LANCASTER, EARL OF WESTMORELAND, with WORCESTER and VERNON prisoners

lines.speaker: king henry the fourth
lines.text: Thus ever did rebellion find rebuke. Illspirited Worcester! did not we send grace, Pardon and terms of love to all of you And wouldst thou turn our offers contrary Misuse the tenor of thy kinsmans trust Three knights upon our party slain today, A noble earl and many a creature else Had been alive this hour, If like a Christian thou hadst truly borne Betwixt our armies true intelligence.

lines.speaker: earl of worcester
lines.text: What I have done my safety urged me to And I embrace this fortune patiently, Since not to be avoided it falls on me.

lines.speaker: king henry the fourth
lines.text: Bear Worcester to the death and Vernon too: Other offenders we will pause upon. How goes the field

lines.speaker: prince henry
lines.text: The noble Scot, Lord Douglas, when he saw The fortune of the day quite turnd from him, The noble Percy slain, and all his men Upon the foot of fear, fled with the rest And falling from a hill, he was so bruised That the pursuers took him. At my tent The Douglas is and I beseech your grace I may dispose of him.

lines.speaker: prince henry
lines.text: Then, brother John of Lancaster, to you This honourable bounty shall belong: Go to the Douglas, and deliver him Up to his pleasure, ransomless and free: His valour shown upon our crests today Hath taught us how to cherish such high deeds Even in the bosom of our adversaries.

lines.speaker: lancaster
lines.text: I thank your grace for this high courtesy, Which I shall give away immediately.

lines.speaker: king henry the fourth
lines.text: Then this remains, that we divide our power. You, son John, and my cousin Westmoreland Towards York shall bend you with your dearest speed, To meet Northumberland and the prelate Scroop, Who, as we hear, are busily in arms: Myself and you, son Harry, will towards Wales, To fight with Glendower and the Earl of March. Rebellion in this land shall lose his sway, Meeting the cheque of such another day: And since this business so fair is done, Let us not leave till all our own be won.
